description: Commit and push all ADHD modules with contextual commit messages
---

# Push All Modules

Commit and push changes across all ADHD modules with reasonable, context-aware commit messages.

## ⚠️ CRITICAL: DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE

User instructions like "only push foundation" are **RUNTIME PARAMETERS**.  
They mean: pass the appropriate layer filter to the tool call.  
They do NOT mean: modify this prompt file.

**NEVER edit this `.prompt.md` file based on user instructions.**

## Scope

| Layer | Default | User Override |
|--------|---------|---------------|
| `foundation/`, `runtime/`, `dev/` | ✅ Included | — |
| Root project repo | ❌ Always excluded | Cannot override |

**How to interpret user phrases:**
- "only foundation" → `layers=["foundation"]` in tool call
- "include dev" → include dev layer modules

## Workflow

### 1. Get Status
```python
git_modules(action="status")
```

### 2. Get Diffs
```python
git_modules(action="diff")
```

### 3. Craft Commit Messages
- Format: `<type>: <description>` (max 72 chars)
- Types: `feat`, `fix`, `docs`, `refactor`, `chore`, `style`, `test`

### 4. Push Each Module (one at a time)
```python
git_modules(action="push", module_name="<name>", commit_message="<msg>")
```

## Example: User says "push all modules"

```python
git_modules(action="status")
git_modules(action="diff")
git_modules(action="push", module_name="adhd_mcp", commit_message="feat: ...")
git_modules(action="push", module_name="logger_util", commit_message="fix: ...")
```

## Response Format
```python
{
  "pushed": [{"name": "...", "commit": "abc123", "message": "..."}],
  "failed": [{"name": "...", "error": "..."}],
  "skipped": [{"name": "...", "reason": "No changes"}]
}
